sentences.sContent: The family acknowledge the need for change.
sentences.sCn: 全家人都承认需要改变一下。

sentences.sContent: Claire acknowledged that she was guilty.
The government must acknowledge what is happening and do something about it.
sentences.sCn: 对于目前的情况，政府必须承认其存在并对此采取措施。

sentences.sContent: This is a fact that most smokers readily acknowledge .
sentences.sCn: 这是大多数烟民都愿意承认的事实。

sentences.sContent: ...The researchers acknowledge that since the families they studied were all middle-class Israelis...
...we also acknowledge that using race as a political or social category to study racism...
...but school-leavers who fail to acknowledge as much risk making the wrong decision about going to university...
...But they also acknowledge that concerns about “resource security” influence their moves...
...Supervisors should acknowledge high performance so that the employee will continue to perform well in the future...
...If supervisors do not acknowledge such outstanding performance...

synos.tran: 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到

remMethod.val: ac ＋ know(知道) ＋ ledge → 大家都知道了， 所以不得不承认 → 承认

words.tran: 承认；确认（acknowledge的过去式和过去分词）；答谢

trans.tranCn: 承认， 承认…的权威； 告知收到， 确认； 对…表示谢意， 报偿
trans.tranOther: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists
